title: Art in lockdown: Making anthotype plant prints
description: Photographer Tim Boddy turned to plants to create art at his home in East London.

title: Borders Railway: 'The line has re-energised our community'
description: How has the return of a train service after more than 40 years affected one small Scottish village?

title: US election 2020: Has Trump kept his promises on the military?
description: The president pledged to increase military funding and bring US troops home. What has he achieved?

title: Traveller families: 'We just want to live on the land we legally own'
description: Six Traveller families are challenging a decision which would force them to leave the land they own.

title: Thwaites: 'Doomsday Glacier' vulnerability seen in new maps
description: Sea and airborne surveys show how Antarctica's mighty Thwaites ice stream can be melted from below.

title: Fall Guys: Tiny blobs, obstacle courses and hate mail
description: Fall Guys has had millions of downloads, but even fluffy obstacle courses can't make everyone happy.

title: Singapore: The mums asking suicidal teens to 'please stay'
description: Singaporean mothers who lost children to suicide have formed a group to help other at-risk youths.

title: Student finance: 'It's tough to find money for the bills'
description: Concerns are raised about students' ability to pay living costs as coronavirus hits their job options.

title: US wildfires leave small towns almost destroyed in California and Washington
description: It's estimated that nearly 80% of structures in Malden, Washington state, have been lost.

title: Coronavirus: Bolton restrictions to be tightened
description: Tighter restrictions are introduced in Bolton, including limiting hospitality venues to takeaways, in response to rise in coronavirus cases.

title: US 2020 Election: Trump targeted in misleading puddle video
description: Trump targeted in online manipulated video of puddle and a sunken boat photo.

title: Northern Ireland Secretary admits new bill will 'break international law'
description: Brandon Lewis says a new post-Brexit law will go against agreements in a "specific and limited way".

title: Coronavirus: Government apologises over tests shortage
description: A director of the government's test and trace scheme in England says lab capacity is the issue.

title: Earthquake hits towns in Bedfordshire and Buckinghamshire
description: The British Geological Survey says a 3.3 magnitude quake hits the Leighton Buzzard area.

title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: One paramedic at scene for 40 minutes after blast
description: The Manchester attack inquiry hears victims were taken from the venue on makeshift stretchers.

title: Coronavirus: New cases in all Scottish mainland areas
description: The latest figures include the deaths of three more people who had tested positive - the highest since 30 June.

title: Coronavirus: Caerphilly county lockdown to go into October
description: After a spike in cases, socialising and travel bans will come into force, but pubs remain open.

title: Neville names seven newcomers in England training squad
description: England head coach Phil Neville gives debut call-ups to seven players for his 30-strong training squad as Fran Kirby returns after illness.

title: Civil service: Government's top lawyer to stand down
description: Jonathan Jones, the government's top lawyer, will leave his role when his term ends in April.

title: Mason Greenwood: England forward apologises over quarantine breach
description: England forward Mason Greenwood says he "only has himself to blame" after being dropped for breaching Covid-19 guidelines in Iceland.

title: Why Lucy Bronze has left Lyon and returned to Manchester City
description: England defender Lucy Bronze says she wants to help "push the club on a little bit more" after re-signing for Manchester City from European champions Lyon.

title: Lucy Bronze: Manchester City re-sign England right-back from Lyon
description: England right-back Lucy Bronze leaves Women's Champions League winners Lyon to return to her former club Manchester City.

title: Kesgrave shooting: Gun found in schoolboy attack inquiry
description: Police say a "long-barrelled" gun was recovered in connection with the shooting of a schoolboy.

title: Andrew Lloyd Webber warns the arts are at 'point of no return'
description: The famous composer and theatre owner says socially distanced audiences are not financially viable.

title: Craigavon: Health chief apologises after fourth Covid-19 death
description: Seven patients remain "very unwell" at Craigavon Area Hospital, with more than 80 staff self-isolating.

title: SoFi Stadium: Look at the Los Angeles Rams and Chargers new stadium
description: Take a look at the world's most expensive stadium, home to two NFL teams, the Los Angeles Rams and Chargers.

title: Michael Cohen's Trump book: The ex-lawyer's key claims
description: The White House insists the "tell-all" book by the president's former lawyer is full of lies.

title: The Papers: 'Bitter Brexit row' and Harry's 'Netflix and bill'
description: Most of Tuesday's newspapers lead on Brexit ahead of the next round of trade talks in London.

title: A68 at Fala: The collapsed road rebuilt in under a month
description: Images show the scale of the operation to get traffic back on the A68 from the Borders to Edinburgh.

title: Coronavirus: 'I paid for my student house, now all my lectures are online'
description: Students are finding out their course this term will be online but many have already paid for rent.

title: Coronavirus: What is anxiety and how can I get help?
description: Changes in all our lives have increased anxiety levels but there is support and advice available.

title: English spelling campaigners enlist the help of Hamlet
description: The English Spelling Society uses a speech from Hamlet to demonstrate other ways of spelling.

title: Manctopia: Will progress make or break this council estate?
description: Manchester is growing fast, but some older residents feel they are being forced to give up their homes.
